intro: Neomuellera welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitschii mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces showy yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the rainy season. It is adapted to arid environments and can live for several decades, making it a long-lived species. Neomuellera welwitschii is also notable for its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
